title: Riot is so careful about "nerfing " ADCs... meanwhile
body:
Notice how slow and methodical Riot is when it comes to nerfing ADCS. What are supposed to be nerfs to curb these marksmen who are too strong turn into mere powershifts which do little to address the underlying problems with these champions.

Look at Lucians case. We were fed bullshit about 'hes in the lab' for 2 months, and after their supposed experiments they released a champion who was even more obnoxious than his prenerf state, boasting similar base stats and a better passive than a famous melee carry who was butchered at the start of the year(props to you if you know who)

Tristanas situation was similar, a number of almost irrelevant nerfs, and when the populace cried for more, a simple powershift asking her to rely more on her Q.

Meanwhile... 

'Hmm Jax's splitpushing seems to be a problem in competitive... butcher him!' - 
'Riven seems to be strong in the meta right now.. destroy her!'

People dont notice Shyvana has been the most nerfed champion this year, for example. No compensations or power shifts, just destruction

I could give so many examples, but i dont want a long post. Just look at the champions with lowest popularity coupled with winrates right now, and youll notice a whole host of Riot 'balance fixes' rejects splattered at the bottom.

Why is Riot so biased towards marksmen?

Because in teamfights that means it is essentially a 6v5.

Um... no, it means it's a 5v5.  A duelist is strong in a 1v1, but is lacking in group fights due to a lack of any significant AOE.  This is why Renekton is better at team fights than Jax, because he brings a decent bit of AOE and CC to the fight.  While an assassin makes a great duelist, in a team fight all they can really do is flank around and hope to pick off a carry before their team takes too much damage, a mage on the other hand is in the thick of it dropping so much damage most assassins can only dream of hitting those numbers (AOE means hitting multiple people, so imagine the meh numbers of a mage ult times four from hitting three or four people.)

Except that Jax hyperscales and is still a strong teamfighter with his AoE stun. Duelist may lack AoE, but their damage output allows them to focus a single target down (which will be less than 2.5 seconds a target) and move on to the next one rapidly. Vayne's kit (back at the time) allowed her to reposition outside of the effects of AoE and made her extremely slippery. The enemy team had a hell of a time trying to focus her down, while at the same time Vayne's 4 other teammates were destroying them. Now I am not trying to paint the picture that she was absolutely broken and monstrous, but being too strong of a duelist can be problematic.

You make a good point, the reason why many duelists and duelist items have taken some love taps in order to bring them down to level.  Riot wants there to be a balance in the league, it may not be perfect, but it's better than people think.  When facing a champion in their strongest phase of the game, you NEED to act accordingly, build properly and use the right tactics to best them or else they will destroy you as they Should.  
You don't dive a Renekton who just hit six.
You don't duel Fiddlesticks without heavy CC and burst.
You don't chase Singed.
These are things they Want you to do.  If you fall for it, you deserve to die.

Part of the issue with ADCs is they either instantly die and be useless, or they live and have the highest damage of anything. It's too 1 dimensional. A class of champions this 1 dimensional can't be balanced happily for all tiers, and Riot also tends to lean towards helping lower tiers by nerfing "pubstompers".

Some players perceive the ADC role as weak because they undervalue tower killing and don't abuse the ranged advantage that an ADC naturally has.

(not disagreeing, just stating what seems to be the case)

To an extent, you're correct. 

The real problem with the marksman class is that they rely on multiplicative stats, which requires them to buy multiple offensive items to be effective. This is the goal of the class, it creates the need for gold rather than XP in order to be relevant, creating easily understood counterplay like denying farm and rushing objectives in the mid game.

The problem is that if a champion is inherently squishy and buys nothing but offensive items they are easily killed unless they receive peel from their team. Marskmen are fantastic in 5s teams because of the level of coordination they have. In solo queue, on the other hand, marksmen can get caught out and be useless or they can have team mates who ignore them or whatever.

Riot has created a champion archetype that people enjoy playing because they feel like they single-handedly win the late game for their team, but is also one of the most toxic roles because that archetype also cannot defend themselves at all and they are quick to blame their team for not protecting them because after 25 minutes, "that's your job. Protect me at all costs".

You don't seem to be taking into account that the Champion pool for ADC is far smaller than that of Top Lane Melees.

There's 15ish is ADCs, not including the "Marksmen" like Teemo and such.

There's easily ***double*** that who are viable to go Top, so of course they're more quickly / easily nerfed due to the pool being larger. Ren / Shyv / Mundo all too strong? Nerf them, Darius, Singed and Lee can easily take their place, as well as many others.

Lucian / Trist / Cait too strong? Nerf them so that Varus / Ashe / Jinx can be on the mountain top... but then if you nerf those three, the pool is small enough you'd have to consider re-buffing people you had nerfed before.

> Ranged ADCs should not be compared to the entire melee lineup for top lane. Ranged ADCs should be an archtype like bruisers, tanks, mages, and assassins and compete with other archtypes for lane positions. The fact that ranged ADCs are so powerful that every team is forced to dedicate a position just for them shows just how overpowered they are.

Ranged is an archetype like Tanks, Bruisers, etc, but Top Lane has a pool viable for Mages vs. Tanks, Bruisers vs. Assassins, etc. ADCs have ADC / Support vs. ADC / Support.

And no, it hardly shows how "overpowered" they are, it shows that a system that's been in place since ***Dungeons & Dragons*** works and is the most effective. What system?

A team made up of a Tank / Fighter, Off Tank / Fighter, Healer / Support, Magic DPS and Ranged DPS ***works*** to the best of a team's ability, bar none, especially when you add in the "Tower Defense" portion of LoL, which are ADCs' main strength.

It's a formula that's been working for forever and will continue to do so for as long as Ranged has any sort of natural advantage over Melee... which will be ****always****.

> The goal isn't to nerf lucians/trist/cait to the level of lower adcs, the goal should be to nerf ALL ranged adcs up until the point where they are not the only archtype that has a dedicated role.

But... all archetypes ***do*** have a dedicated role unless they aren't balanced and can spill into other places where they mess with the current stock of Champions. That's kind of why they are ***archetypes***, they're made to be specifically good at X.

Annie, for instance, was pretty much a dedicated AP Mage / Burst Mage in Mid, however she wasn't very strong compared to other Mid laners such as other Burst Mages, Assassins or Utility Mages (Ori). Supports got nerfed and things got changed on a larger scale so Annie shifted down to Support while retaining all of her Mid Lane power (which made her more powerful than the current crop of Supports, y'know, the archetypal Supports like Sona and Janna).

Annie had her archetype, then a different portion of the game got weaker so she moved, she proved stronger than the surrounding archetype, got nerfed and is now no longer in either Mid or Bot Lane.

> Except league has never had a situation where every archtype is needed on a team. Ranged ADCs have been the only archtype that has been needed in every single season. All of the other roles are weak enough that small changes in the meta COMPLETELY ELIMINATE them from a team. Ranged ADCs are the only archetype that has been so overpowered that they have been immune to this.

Really? Show me a time where a Support has never been needed. And by "Support" I mean the ability to provide Support / Utility to a team, because even Annie being a Burst Caster still provided utility. Show me a time where Off Tanks were completely eliminated. ADC is hardly the only archetype that has been needed every Season. Every Season has required Off Tanks and Support / Utility. There's not been a single Season where a team with no utility has been effective.
 
> ALso, where do you get the idea that all archtypes have a dedicated spot on teams? Annies is a dedicated ap mage/ burst mage but ap mage / burst mage is not a required role on every team like ranged ADCs are. You can make a strong team without an ap mage. You can make a strong team without a pure tank. You can make a strong team without a melee adc. You can make a strong team without an ap or ad assasin. You can make a strong team without a bruiser. You CANNOT make a strong team without a ranged adc. That is the problem right now.

And why do you think that is? Because at the end of the day, this is still a "Tower Defense" objective style game. It's really that simple.

Assassins aren't Tower Killers.
AP Mages as a whole aren't Tower Killers.
Tanks? Bruisers? Not Tower Killers as a whole.
Melee ADCs? Yeah, they can kill towers, from *close range*.

Why on God's Green would you pick someone who has to get in close to kill a Tower in a siege based environment when you can pick someone who can do the same thing from farther away? No seriously... why on Earth would you trade say... Cait, for a Master Yi for sieging and pushing down a Tower as a team?

I'm pretty sure even if you look strictly at primary roles, ADC (marksman, whatever) would still be the one with the smallest champion pool. Maybe support is lower but then you'd have to take into consideration all of the champions that are commonly played as supports and are primarily tagged as mages or tanks.

The only way to make ADC optional in this game would be to 1) make buildings take significantly reduced damage from ranged attacks and 2) tweek casters so that they are somehow able to put out the same DPS as an ADC in a fight (but then I'm not sure you'd want to fight this monstrosity). 

Face it, this is a game where the goal is to knock down buildings until you kill the Nexus, which is also a building. All the rest - farming, kills, getting jungle objectives - is only a mean to this end. So long as the game is played this way, LoL will be very ADC-centric because it is the class who has the best tools to take down buildings safely and quickly.

Jayce dominates entire teams from a long range with AoE damage. Untouched for a while now.

Irelia still dominates with high sustain, innate tenacity, works very well with few resists, and has true damage. Still been strong for most of the season.

Ryze has insanely high damage ratios that scale off of mana (???) while being able to itemize for resists. Untouched, if not buffed. 

I'm much more scared of the bruisers and mages that go untouched than I am of ADC, ever.
